column4: i have a problem with dapper, it randomly reboots without any notice
any ideas?
reboots in what sens?
just reboot
like, clean shutdown (shutdown screens, etc)?  or just shutdown right now like you hit the reset switch?
not clean
and it actually reboots, not just giving you a blank screen that you have to reboot from...
any triggers?
only when you leave and come back, or only while working on it?
i.e., I've seen some screensavers cause that type of failure (fyreworks does it to me on a couple of my machines)
yes it reboots, and no apparent triggers, sometimes it reboots while working on it and sometimes when it's idle
actually it's not my machine i'm troublehooting, it's my girlfirends so i'm pretty much blind here :P
have you seen it crash personally, or are you just in front of it now having not seen it yet, or thirdly are you troubleshooting verbally?  :)
verbally
so you're not in front of the machine then?  :/
not at the moment no. but i thought that maybe it was a common bug or smth
well, the specifics matter quite a bit in this case, and third party descriptions have a way of being inaccurate 90% of the time :)
could be anything from a hardware failure (bad power supply, etc) to a software package isse
ok thanks anyway :)
if you get on the machine, I'd look at the contents of dmesg and other stuff in /var/log
i suspected bad ram, cos it a quite old machine
I'd actually suspect the ps first
